content.question: Let f be a continuous function on the closed interval [0,2]. If <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" aria-label="2 less than or equal to f of x less than or equal to 4"> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaaIYaGaeyizImQaamOzaiaacIcacaWG4bGaaiykaiabgsMiJkaa isdaaaa@3E3B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> , then the greatest possible value of<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" aria-label="the integral from 0 to 2 of f of x with respect to x"> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow><munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>2</mn> </munderover> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWdXbWdaeaapeGaamOzaaWcpaqaa8qacaaIWaaapaqaa8qacaaI YaaaniabgUIiYdGccaGGOaGaamiEaiaacMcacaWGKbGaamiEaaaa@3F83@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> is
